Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable. very nice.”
Reviews.Author: Christysdad
Reviews.Content: Spacious, clean and comfortable, our room (104) had three beds, an armchair and a sofa, with TV (but no BBC). For the two of us. Nice bathroom, including an actual bath, while the kitchen facilities included pans and plates etc with the two electric rings. Fridge was especially useful. AC worked well while there were cool shutters at the windows. Noise from the street no big deal. Wifi worked well. Around the corner, a supermarket as well as fruit and veg shop and a lovely bakery. We used the Valcarca metro stop. Get off fourth stop from the airport (Passeig de Gracia), then change from the railway station to the metro (green line L3, direction Trinitat Nova) which involves going up to street level. Once at Valcarca, you want the right hand exit of two, to the route de Argentina. The exit is on the same level as the viaduct. If you're looking UP at the viaduct once outside, you've taken the wrong exit. Then turn right and walk up the hill, across the viaduct junction, and on to the next traffic lights, passing the LObrador bread shop on the left. Turn left at the traffic lights (Vitages), up Marie de Deu del Carmel, then walk to the end where you will find Carrer Bertran and the hotel just on the left. Simples!

Reviews.Title: “I recommand people to stay here”
Reviews.Author: VENU GOPAL C Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 days in Barcelona and stayed 4 nights in this hotel with wife and 8month old daughter. I liked this hotel and service is very quick and excellent. One causion is...when you take metro to Valgarga, you should be careful while you com out of the station. We came out at other end and missed the route to the hotel. Check with reception for the correct route.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: russ27973
Reviews.Content: 4 nights spent in Hotel Bertran - very nice big rooms with very clean facilities, more than enough room for 2 adults and a toddler, Cot supplied at no extra cost. food ordered in (10 euro minimum) from menus supplied and also good local food options 5 min walk away. Transport options as others have noted are excellent, TMB Train at Av Tibidabo (this is not a metro station, more a local rail stop) is quick for access to Pl catalunya. Vallcarca is not far either and although has a hill up on way back is not at all taxing. Also there is Tramvia Blau for access to Mt.tibidabo (extra charge on top if not using barcelona card) and the Sightseeing bus stops at Av tibidabo so basically anywhere you want to get to you can pretty easily. next time we go to barcelona, we would use the hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Out of six days, one and half were spent trying to get the room fixed.”
Reviews.Author: 545Lisa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a room a year in advance and confirmed the reservation before we arrived, asking for a room with a balcony and noting that we were two people but would pay for whatever size room it took to have a balcony. When we arrived we were given a cramped, expensive room for four with no balcony and told that one could not reserve specific types of rooms! They did move us after the first night (although we were charged as if we spent the week in the larger room we did not want), but we had to vacate the first room by eleven and were not allowed into the new room until mid-afternoon. The rooftop pool area was not a terrible place to wait with our luggage, but we went to Barcelona to see the city, not the inside of the hotel, Also, although the balcony we finally got was lovely (with an amazing view), the shutters were closed by the maid -- although we asked in Spanish, English, and using the card one puts on one's door that the balcony door not be shuttered -- and got stuck. So we spent another half day waiting for someone to come fix the shutter allowing us to sit on the balcony. Finally, the stove did not work (using it tripped the circuit breaker). Oh yes: the maid came in daily and turned off the electricity, which meant the refrigerator in which we kept food was endangered. Again, repeated efforts to have this stop yielded nothing. The little grocery store downstairs was nice, as was the location and access to the metro; it was also quiet. However, we would not stay at the Aparthotel Bertran again, simply because we spent so much time dealing with getting a room, a balcony, and a working stove (eventually we did get one of two burners to work) -- time we would rather have spent seeing the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Richard G
Reviews.Content: In general, the other reviews of this hotel are pretty accurate. I stayed there because it was close to where I needed to be and also because of the reasonable cost. I found all of the staff to be very friendly and helpful and, as an English-speaking person, was grateful that all staff could speak enough English for me to find out what I needed. The room I had was quite basic with not much in the way of outlook but, it was kept clean, had generous space and fulfilled the requirements of my visit. It is probably best to cater for yourself and there is a local mini-supermarket store about 5 minutes walk away. The room had a double hob for cooking, a slightly noisy refrigerator, and cutlery, pans, cork screw, plates, etc., provided - although unusually, not a kettle. There is close access to a few shops and the L7 Metro line is the most convenient way to get quickly into the main city areas. (During my visit, a 10-trip Metro ticket for zone 1 was about 8 Euros but, be aware if you have children and/or buggies or wheelchairs, that some Metro stations have a lot of steps and some do not appear to have lifts). About 15 to 20 minutes walk from the hotel is the superb Cosmocaixa Science Museum - great for everyone, with plenty for children and adults to look at and try out with dinosaurs and interactive displays. It also has a good restaurant area. Across the road from the museum, you can set off for a trek up hill to the Collserola park towards the Collserola Tower (designed by Norman Foster and covered in ariels - and easily seen from the air if you fly into Barcelona) quite a steep walk up hill but, then a flat winding path for as many miles as you care to walk - also popular with cyclists. The hotel is ideal if you do not want to be in too much of a tourist environment but, with all the benefits to reach the busier areas when you want to. Initially, it can be a bit daunting to find your way around Barcelona but, after a couple of days you find it is actually quite easy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms, super helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: jogo75
Reviews.Content: We loved this place- it's literally 20 min door to door to downtown, 15 min walk to Park Guell, etc. the rooms are big and have large balcony spaces and mini-kitchens, and the staff was extremely nice and helpful. When our flight got cancelled last minute, they waived our first night's payment without any second thought-- for the money, this has to be one of the best value hotels in the city

Reviews.Title: “Good but not for us”
Reviews.Author: SHOPnDINE
Reviews.Content: We got there to find that instead of a two bedroom apartment we were given one bedroom with an extra cot bed. It was not convenient for us so we spent one night and moved to another hotel. The hotel is located in a quiet neighborhood easily accessible by public transport and the room is quite spacious with kitchen amenities. The furniture is a bit old but clean. Would recommend it for couples and families with small children that prefer to save up on food by cooking from themselves

Reviews.Title: “Our second time at this hotel, would definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: sansone941
Reviews.Content: Location is great, parking invaluable as better taking metro in Barcelona. Staff lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Nice convient hotel in the suburbs of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Parakeet701
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights here in May 2011. Our room was very clean and we had a very large private terrace. Decoration was basic and simple. In a quite residential neighborhood which was very nice. Only a 5 minute walk to the metro. A bit of advice: there are 2 stations withing walking distance - Ave. Tibidabo on Line 7 of the FGC and Vallcarca on Line 3 of the Metro. The Ave. Tibidabo station was much easier to get to, to get to Vallcarca you have to walk up and over a large hill so it is a more difficult walk. Line 7 took us directly to Plaza Catalunya in only 10 minutes so very convenient. We bought the 5 day travel card that included buses, metro, tram and FGC trains which was very handy and great value. Staff was very friendly and helpful. A basic no frills hotel, would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “depends on what you're after”
Reviews.Author: rossBeefInFrance
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel simply for its location - it was close to where I needed to be for a two-night stay in Barcelona - and also because of the very positive reviews that I'd seen on tripadvisor and elsewhere. So positive were the reviews that I was left rather disappointed. It was entirely adequate for what I needed but nothing to write home about. Perfectly clean though rather dated and the room smelt a little stale - perhaps it had not been used for a while but the window was open when I arrived. The apartment was large with separate bathroom and open plan equipped kitchenette, living/eating area and bed. Despite the international tv services I could only find Spanish/Catalan channels. Wifi service was free but pretty poor. There is no breakfast room but for 9 Euros it can be delivered to your door in the morning. It wasn't bad but there's only one cup of coffee. Staff were very friendly, helpful and fluent in English. There is a very convenient, regular and cheap train direct to the centre. Station is 5 minutes walk away from the hotel. I did not use any of the other hotel facilities so can't comment on them. Probably best recommended for the budget traveler who either needs to be in that area or who wants the kitchenette facilities.

Reviews.Title: “A jewel of a place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: bdaniels912
Reviews.Content: The hotel Bertran is a fabulous place to stay. It is located in a superb neighborhood of Barcelona. The director Carlos is a phenomenal person and extremely helpful. His associate Danny is also great. The overall staff were superb. The rooms were wondeful. It was quiet and helpful to your overall demeanor. The neighborhood was just wonderful. There were so many fine shops. The public transportation system is fantastic. In fact the subway system is probably one of the best in the world. The subway station was a close walk from the hotel. I unhesitatingly support staying here. It was a very important highlight and anchor to my very positive time in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, spacious apartments, close to metro stations”
Reviews.Author: jade405
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. We were able to check in without problems even if we arrived after midnight, hours later than we were supposed to. The apartment was pretty large, giving us enough space to relax after days spent walking all over the city. There are dishes in the kitchen and towels are changed daily. There are two metro stations nearby, for the L3 and L7.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and a real find (If you manage to)”
Reviews.Author: WeeFergus
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in the middle of September and would highly recommend it to anyone not wanting 5* facilities (or price). OK, it was very difficult to find the hotel in the first place but, after that, we found the metro station which was just 5 minutes away at Ave. Tibidabo made it a great location for popping into and out of the city centre. The tram and furnicular up to the top of Tibidabo and access to the hop on/off tourist bus were also only 5 minutes walk away so the out of town location was actually quite a bonus. The apartment was spacious and very clean and, although we initially had one at the front of the hotel, we were moved to one at the back after we complained about the traffic noise and a malfunctioning toilet. The staff were always very pleasant and helpful - even when we complained after our first night. We didn't really use the kitchen apart from making cups of coffee in the morning but it seemed fairly well equipped - despite the lack of a kettle (we used a pan to heat up the water for our coffee). Having a fridge was also useful for storing the cold drinks that we bought at the nearby supermarket. We also had a balcony with a table and chairs but, as we'd come to see the city, we never actually made use of it nor the swimming pool. We never managed to get the TV to show anything other than Spainsh programmes despite the instructions in the room to change to International ones and it would have been nice to catch a bit of BBC news now and again. Overall, we enjoyed staying there and it was nice in the evening to leave the bustle of the city centre and make our 10 minute trip 'home'. The price, at 65 euros per night, was surpringingly good.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic value for money but TINY pool”
Reviews.Author: Simi65
Reviews.Content: The apartment was great - three bedrooms (two single one with extra bed and a large en-suite double) it is in a quiet residential area with very few tourists which for me was a bonus! The bus, tram and metro are all within easy walking distance and connect you to the centre of Barcelona within 10 -15 minutes. The lounge was air conditioned but the bedrooms weren't so in August it was hot and there were no fans. The staff were friendly and helpful. The only disappointment was the pool which was probably about 14 foot square. Great for splashing around with kids but not for anyone that wants to seriously swim - two strokes and and you are at the end! That said, it was on the roof, quiet and my seven year old son and I had a great time in it! Lots of supermarkets around which open till late and lots of eating places to suit all budgets- I recommend eating Pizza round the corner which were fanatastic and good value for money.. unlike the steak! Don't be put off by the photos which don't do the area justice.

Reviews.Title: “welcome to the 70s!”
Reviews.Author: synaptoneurosome
Reviews.Content: After staying for nearly a week in a much swankier hotel downtown, my partner and I moved to Aparthotel Bertran, as it was one of the few places we could find availability for our final two nights. It was pretty special. Spacious, yes. Stylish, no. It's located in a northern part of town, which is actually really easy to reach by the metro line that goes directly north from Placa de Catalunya (take it all the way up to the Tibidabo stop). The neighbourhood is interesting (hilly!), and much more residential that other parts of barcelona. It's proximity to Tibidabo and Parc Güell is a bonus too (we walked to both places... it was a long, sweaty hike to Tibidabo, but worth it, and Parc Güell is just amazing). Now, for the hotel itself... It's more like a small apartment, so nice and spacious. But my god, the decor needs serious work. Dark, dismal, and slightly dank, the rooms are the antithesis of cheery and pleasant. The bathroom also looks like it hasn't had a makeover since the 70s, and the tub was especially offputting with lots of permanent black marks covering the bottom. The one bright spark, though, was the rooftop pool. It's little more than the size of a standard hot tub, but the views from the roof are spectacular, and it's a really nice place to spend a few hours on a sunny afternoon. So, not a terrible place, and stay there if you must, but I feel like this place could go from blah to wow with a serious makeover.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with this little find - we...”
Reviews.Author: HanScalzo
Reviews.Content: Very happy with this little find - we spent a week here with a small child, and had a great time. Location is out of town, but very easy to get to, only a short walk from the Tibidabo Terminus (L7?!) The staff were very helpful; we got a cot it the room no problem, and as our flight home was a late one, they looked after our bags for the day... Just to note-the roof top pool isn't heated - April is still too cold to enjoy this(!) and the "gym" is very basic!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location - quiet hotel - great value - friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: ColchesterEssexWendy
Reviews.Content: we booked a weekend in the hotel but due to the Iceland ash incident we ended up staying ten days. we kept our room which had a kitchen area, lounge and bedroom and this was a godsend as we had to cater for ourselves to try and save some cash. The staff were helpful, as we tried to make arrrangements to leave the country and allowed us unlimited use of the internet etc. we were given a reduced rate and felt that we had been looked after very well given the circumstances. The hotel is on a quiet backstreet in the Uptown area of town, and only five stops on the train to the centre of Barcelona. The transport system is cheap and we found it easy to get around from the area we were in. I would reccomend the hotel and if you want to cater for yourself, its a great deal

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, hospitable, kind employees, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Dutchtraveler2010
Reviews.Content: Though it's not nearby the centre, there is a train (Line 7) nearby, which travels directly to Catalunya within 10 minutes. There was a kind of quiet atmosphere we liked a lot. Of course that could have been the result of the fact we were there at a time there were not many guests in the hotel. We didn't try the breakfast, but we liked the fact it is an apartment: there is a small electric cooking stove and a fridge.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, ideal for families in safe neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: kajambe
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in October 2009 as part of 2 months in Europe. We drove into Barcelona straight into the hotel's car park then left the car there for the duration of our stay. This was a great venue for this arrangement, as lots of places either don't have parking or are much further out of the city centre and not so close to public transport. The hotel staff were really pleasant and helpful with maps and directions, and best of all it was a real pleasure to wander the streets nearby in the evenings, either to gather provisions for dinner from the local stores or to walk out to a restaurant. There were always families with children on the street which made it feel very safe. The decor was a bit dated and daggy, but the room was clean and spacious. I'm pretty fussy but I reckon it was great value for money and I'd absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Aparthotel Bertran.....Maravilloso!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sweetshrimp
Reviews.Content: I would HIGHLY recommend staying at the Bertran, especially if you are looking for convenience, comfort and savings. The hotel is nestled in a very clean and friendly neighborhood with plenty of restaurants, bars, pharmacies and bakeries. The hotel is also about a 10 minute walk to two different train stations, which were both easy to find. The rooms themselves are very large, I stayed in one room with my spouse and we had both a full and twin bed, two couches, a kitchenette with fridge and table. We had problems with our AC but they fixed that issue immediately. The water-pressure is wonderful and we used their great pool on the roof three times, at least. If you don't mind navigating the trainline a bit and being somewhat outside of the city, again I strongly suggest booking your trip here!

Reviews.Title: “Great apartment hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Lailasmom
Reviews.Content: This is an efficiency apartment ' that is located in a suburban Barcelona neighborhood instead of downtown. It is near a metro line and easy to get to once you know where to find it. It made a perfect base from which to explore the city. We stayed in a suite with two bedrooms, two baths, a kitchen and living/dining room for four people (2 adults, 2 kids). It was a bit shabby (the living room furniture had been around) but was very comfortable and clean. The kitchen had modern appliances, and I was able to cook several meals there to save money. There was also a wash basin on an adjacent porch and a wire laundry dryer on the patio so we could do laundry in the middle of the trip. The hotel concierge was very friendly and helpful. There was a pool in the "hotel" building next door on the roof that the kids loved. (We stayed in the "apartment" building). There are several small markets nearby to buy food it you don't want to eat out all the time. I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: MaJaFinland
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 8 nights and were really pleased that we chose Aparthotel Bertran. The staff were very helpful and friendly. Room was clean and spacious. Pool area was nice even though the pool was smaller than expected. Hotel is located near a metro station so it takes only 10 min to the city central. We highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, location and service”
Reviews.Author: Tinsler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just what we were looking for in every respect. In particular its location allowed my wife and I to follow our interests ( Park Guell, Tibidado and the Tourist bus are all virtually on the doorstep ) whilst our 18 year old son was able to make independent trips to the Ramblas, the Noucamp and so on. Do not be put off by the approach to the Hotel which is down a dusty side-street and don't let the absence of a balcony or sea-view upset you - you are here to experience the delight of the city from a functional base at a reasonable cost. Two tips. This is not a good area for eating out but O'Carballo tapas bar two minutes from the hotel can be recommended. Also if travelling to or from the Airport by Underground aim for Valcarca Metro station (rather than the nearer Av Tibidado) and change at Passeig de Gracia.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to go back to every day after sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: travelyun
Reviews.Content: We like this place. We stayed for 5 nights and were happy with almost every aspect of it. Yes it was slightly out of the way - but you are just about 10 min by metro into city centre, and you have 2 choices of routes. The staff were friendly enough to not be "too much", apart from not having too many recommendations for the local restaurants. I like how it is in a residential area, so you feel that you are going "home" - it also is spacious, which is not that common in Europe. It has a kitchen and we have cooked one meal there. There were a few cafes, bakeries, supermarkets around, and a couple of fresh produce stores that just look really inviting. It is also close by to Park Guell, which was the coolest park I've been to. All in all, we were happy with the stay and we would happily go back there. Oh not to mention the price was very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great New Year”
Reviews.Author: chaderoonie
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 5 day break covering the New Year period. The hotel is spotlessly clean and the staff are very helpfull. the room was cleaned daily and always smelled fresh. We had a big room, kitchen, dining room area and lounge area. the bedroom is a bit dark but the whole apartment is spacious and comfortable. A good tip is to travel in to the station at tibidabo as this is closer and a flater walk. The hotel is in a quiet residential neighbourhood which feels very safe. There are numerous shops and supermarkets very close. Our only issue was the daily commute in and out of the city Centre which for someone who commutes into London daily I found a bit tiresome. Great Value booked through Venere.

Reviews.Title: “No fuss - just good clean comfort.”
Reviews.Author: happy_camper015
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at this unpretentious yet comfortable hotel in early December and would thoroughly recommend it. We had no plans to visit Barcelona, but being unable to resist bargain flights, we booked this hotel via a link from this website through Venere.com. The exterior of the hotel does not really inspire a good first impression, but once inside the hotel any fears were laid to rest by the warmth of the welcome from the excellent reception staff. We were first allocated a twin room (at the quieter back of the hotel), and when we asked for an alternative room with a double bed, this was attended to instantly without any fuss or comeback. Our room was at the front of the hotel which was fine despite some traffic noise. Our bed was some distance from the window, and the road outside (a peak hour rat run) became much quieter later on and we had no problem sleeping. In fact the bed was so comfy that the only problem was getting out of it. The chair and sofa were also very comfortable. There was no fussy trimmings here, but everything was very practical. Although short of a fully equipped apartment, there was enough here for all your City Break needs (warm through and serve your purchase at the local deli, or to prepare a picnic) and the good size fridge was invaluable. There was no safe in the room but the free use of a safe was available at a secure location within the hotel with a 10 Euro refundable deposit for the key (Inquire at reception).The only problem we encountered was the heating could be overbearing at times, and the only way to temper this was to use the air conditioning (during a December cold snap!). For breakfast we fell in love with the wonderful crunchy bread and delicious patisseries from the numerous local bakeries. The cleaning staff here did a fantastic job, and the room was always pristine on our return. Only a tea towel that has seen better days preventing a perfect score for cleanliness. The location of this property in a mainly residential area may not be suitable if you like being in the thick of the action, but we loved it here. Close to Av. Tibidabo and Valcarca metro stations, a T10 (10 journey transport ticket), at 7.20 Euros is a must to get around town. You can even use it for your Airport Transfer from the RENFE station to the hotel for one journey!. We enjoyed unwinding by browsing around the neighbourhood shops, after a day of sightseeing. There are at least 2 good supermarkets, coffee shops, bars, and cheap eat places including the Luciana pizza shop (lovely light based pizzas to eat at the bar or take away); and also the very nice, yet not too expensive Molina Restaurant (thanks previous reviewer). If you stay here take a stroll up to the Puxtet park for breathtaking views. All of these places are under a ten minute walk from the Hotel. In conclusion, the Bertran offers very good accommodation at a good price in a stunning City, and please don’t be put off coming by the endless reports of pickpockets and other tourist related crimes. In our opinion these reports are disproportionate and unfair, and the good people of Barcelona deserve better than constant suspicion, there is a reassuring large police presence all over the city. In all an excellent base for a short break in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: shorty5
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 day stay at this hotel, the facilities were great and good value for money. Rooms were very clean and you received clean towels everyday. The room we stayed in (208) faced the back of the hotel and was very quiet. It had 3 beds ( one being a camp bed) which was very comfy, a setee, easy chair, coffee table, dining table and 4 chairs, kitchen, fridge , television, plenty of wardrobe and cupboard space. The bathroom had bath with shower and a bidet , hairdryer and of course a toilet. Staff were very pleasant and the hotel reception recommended restaurant Molina - at pg.sant gervasi 65, which was only 5 minutes walk away- excellent. The waiter Oscar was very friendly, we even taught him some "Geordie". There is also a supermarket nearby. Breakfast was very generous with 6 items each of buns,sweet pastries, croissants. choice of fruit juice and tea and coffee, all served to your room at a time specified by you.The pool on the roof top looked very nice but small, but the view from there was amazing. Metro station Avinguda tel TIBIDABO was only 10 minutes away from hotel and it takes 10 minutes on metro to CATALUNYA.
